description:

From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Introduction:


Boeing is looking for a Global Engagement Pilot to be based out of Montreal.
At Boeing, we are all innovators on a mission to connect, protect, explore and inspire. From the sea bed to outer space, you’ll learn and grow, contributing to work that shapes the world. Find your future with us. Be a part of a team that is at the leading edge of flight safety, flight training and flight operations.


As a Global Engagement Pilot you will have the opportunity to work with professionals from across the industry and positively impact safety and operations of Boeing flight operations and those of our customers world-wide. In this high visibility position you will interact with pilots, managers, regulators, executives, peers, supporting team personnel, and Subject Matter Experts.

The Role:

The Pilot Services Team is responsible for providing extensive customer engagement with the goal of enhancing flight operations safety and enhancing the use of Boeing products. The Pilot Services Team serves as a representative of the Boeing Company for industry and regulatory engagement. There will be occasional opportunities to act as pilot-in-command on flights, and to deploy to customers in an instructor capacity. The role requires FAA ATP or EASA ATPL, or other international equivalent, and extensive airline training experience.

This position will travel 50% of the time.

Position Responsibilities:

  • Develops and maintains relationships and partnerships with key industry stakeholders, regulatory authorities, industry bodies, peers, partners and direct reports
  • Acquires resources for projects and processes, provides technical management of suppliers and leads process improvements
  • Develops and executes project and process plans, implements policies and procedures and sets operational goals
  • Performs and manages activities to develop and conduct familiarization, qualification, standardization, flight and ground instruction for company and customer aircrew
  • Demonstrated the highest standards of crew resource management in the operation of aircraft
  • Manages, mentors, develops, and evaluates pilots performing aircrew duties, including activities to prepare for and conduct safe flight operations
  • Operates Boeing and customer aircraft as Pilot in Command and Instructor

This vacancy is for an international, locally hired position in Montreal. Benefits and pay are determined at the local level and are not part of Boeing U.S.-based payroll, and will commensurate with experience and qualifications and in accordance with applicable local law. Employment is subject to the candidates’ ability to satisfy all labor and immigration formalities.

Required Qualifications:

  • Experience presenting to all levels of management
  • Current FAA ATP or EASA ATPL or other international equivalent
  • Current FAA or EASA First Class Medical certificate or international equivalent
  • Minimum 5000 hours total flight time in a public transport category aircraft
  • Minimum 1000 hours of flight instructor time
  • Current B737, B787 or B777 type rating
  • Experience as a FAA Part 121 Airline Instructor Pilot and/or Line Check Airman, or International equivalent
  • Possession of a passport or the ability to obtain one and travel both domestically and international
  • Capable of traveling 50% of the time
  • International and transoceanic flight experience
  • Experience with MS Office

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or higher
  • Management experience


Equal Opportunity Employer:

title: Instructor Pilot - Business Aviation Training
description:
Role and Responsibilities

Hello, Professional Pilots! If you're looking to get out of the sky and into the classroom, hit that apply button today!
CAE seeks pilots that have had a variety of experiences to support our Business Aviation Training Programs in Canada.
We offer a variety of excellent benefits inclusive of Dec 25 through January 1 as company holidays!
Instructor Pilot
In this role be responsible for the delivery of flight training in a flight simulator and/or ground school in accordance with the appropriate regulatory agency, CAE approved curriculum, and customer requirements. Act as subject matter expert (SME) ready to lead client(s) through their training. After 1.5+ years, per business needs, designated Instructors are expected to qualify as a Training Center Evaluator (TCE) and customer contract check airman.
  • Provides simulator/flight or classroom instruction on one or more aircraft types as assigned for the issue of licenses, type ratings, internal training, certificates, and pilot qualifications.
  • Responsible for conducting pre and post flight simulator briefings in a thorough, professional manner in accordance with CAE standards
  • Other required administrative duties (completes training records, recommends remedial training when necessary, track his/her own instructional qualifications and activity, etc.)
  • Acts as a subject matter expert (SME) in creation of curricula and courseware when required
Education / Skills / Background
  • Associate degree or college degree preferred; High School diploma or state issued equivalent required
  • 2-5 years of related job-relevant experience
  • Previous experience teaching or training of others preferred.
  • Proven experience demonstrating a customer service orientation of work assignments.
  • Must be authorized to live/work in the United States
  • Basic computer proficiency, Microsoft Office, and other internet-based programs
  • Must be able to participate in CAE’s DOT Anti-Drug & Alcohol testing program
  • Holds an existing instructor qualification or type rating preferred
  • Hold or has held a professional pilots’ license
  • Preferred: FAR Part 135 experience, 3,000 hours of total flight time
  • Preferred: Possess an unrestricted Airline Transport Pilot (ATP) certificate and a minimum of one unrestricted PIC type rating preferred
Physical Requirements of this role include:
  • The physical dexterity required in performing tasks that require hand / eye coordination and fine motor skills.
  • Ability to sit in a confined space for 4-6 hours at a time with limited breaks
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time (as many as 10 hours) with limited breaks
  • Ability to sit, stoop, climb and twist and turn
What to expect:
CAE offers a comprehensive training program to help transform your knowledge and skills as a pilot into a world-class Instructor and subject matter expert ready to lead clients through their training.
The ideal candidate should also possess:
  • A “true” professional character with the ability to create a welcoming and successful learning environment
  • The proven ability to communicate effectively across multiple levels, both spoken and written
  • Commitment to the customer - providing continuous “red carpet” customer service
  • The capability to tailor training sessions to the needs of a diverse customer base
  • A keen eye for detail – must be able and willing to maintain accurate and timely records in accordance with CAE policy and FAA requirements
Why Work for CAE?
CAE recognizes and values our dedicated employees and offers a welcoming and supportive work environment to help make a smooth transition into your new career!
We also offer full-time employees:
  • Competitive base salary and benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Paid Sick Leave and Vacation
  • Paid Holidays - our holidays are currently arranged so you will be off between Dec 25 and January 1
Who is CAE?
CAE is a global leader in modelling, simulation and training for civil aviation. CAE is the largest network of civil training location with more than 210 full-flight simulators in 50+ training locations worldwide. CAE serves worldwide airlines, aircraft operators and manufacturers across the globe. Our vision is to be the recognized global training partner of choice to enhance safety, efficiency and readiness.
Vaccination Requirements
If you are applying for a position with CAE Civil locations: Oklahoma City, OK, Dallas, TX and/or Whippany, NJ, or your role requires you to travel; you must provide proof that you are fully vaccinated (2 weeks since your final dose) against COVID-19 with a CDC- approved vaccine or you must provide us a completed accommodation-request.
Equal Opportunity
CAE is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.
Accessibility
CAE is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail
sfhr@cae.com
or call: 972-456-8347. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.
E-Verify
As a Federal Contractor, CAE is required to participate in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work in the United States. If you’d like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here EEO is the Law poster.
Position Type

Regular
CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
Equal Employment Opportunity
At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.

title: Flight Instructor
description:
About MRU

Founded in 1910 and located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Mount Royal University grew into a vibrant college in the 1930s and became a mid-sized undergraduate university in 2009. Mount Royal has carved out a distinct niche by offering smaller class sizes, a robust liberal education program and unique undergraduate programs. Currently, more than 14,000 credit students choose from 12 bachelor degrees and 36 majors.

Mount Royal University is located in the traditional territories of the Niitsitapi (Blackfoot) and the people of the Treaty 7 region in southern Alberta, which includes the Siksika, the Piikani, the Kainai, the Tsuut'ina and the Iyarhe Nakoda. We are situated on land where the Bow River meets the Elbow River. The traditional Blackfoot name of this place is “Mohkinstsis”, which we now call the city of Calgary. The city of Calgary is also home to the Métis Nation.

Mount Royal University is committed to removing barriers and fostering a post-secondary educational environment that is rich in diversity as represented by our faculty, staff and students. We welcome applications from all qualified persons without regard to race, sexual orientation or gender identity in this commitment to an creating and maintaining an enriched campus community.

 

About the Department of Aviation

Mount Royal University’s Aviation diploma program has been in operation since 1970. The two-year program operates eight aircraft at Springbank Airport along with three simulators. Students enter the program with a Private Pilot License and graduate with a Commercial Pilot License and Multi-IFR in addition to a Diploma in Aviation.

 

About the Role

Mount Royal University Aviation is looking to expand its team of professional and experienced flight instructors.  We offer high quality instruction to students seeking a career in the airline industry. Our flight instructors not only teach in the aircraft, but also in the simulator, and sometimes ground school classes.  All instructors will be expected to teach lessons from PPL through to Multi-IFR, once they are appropriately trained, and to have some administrative responsibilities in addition to working on the flight line.  We employ our instructors on a full-time (40 hours/week), salaried basis. We are open 7 days a week, year-round with flight operations normally scheduled from 07:30 until as late as midnight.

 

Minimum Qualifications

  • Current Instructor Rating and Medical
  • Group 1 Instrument Rating

 

Preference will be given to applicants with some, or many, of the following:

  • Class 1 or 2 Instructor Rating
  • Multi-engine and/or IFR instructing experience
  • Aviation industry experience
  • Airline Transport Pilot Licence
  • Aviation Degree or Diploma
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree

 

Salary and Benefits

  • Four-day work week opportunities
  • Paid Personal Days
  • Paid Sick Days
  • Health Spending Allowance
  • All Statutory Holidays off
  • Two weeks of paid vacation per year and additional paid days off during the Christmas closure (usually between 10 and 14 days)
  • One hour of free Cessna time for each month worked
  • Paid training and upgrades

title: CL600 Challenger Captain & First Officer
description:
POSITION:

Coulson Aviation is searching for a Captain and First Officer for our CL600 Challenger!

ABOUT THE COMPANY:

At Coulson, we know that our employees are our strongest asset. Guided by a successful past and a long-term innovative vision for growth, our future success will be driven by our people and our strategic approach to our work.

Aircraft fire fighting and developing new industrial technologies are much more than pieces of metal and components; we at Coulson are determined to make a difference saving lives and homes. In addition, we strive to improve the environment we share globally.

Family owned and operated since 1960, the Coulson Group of Companies began with Forestry in British Columbia. During the 1990s, Coulson expanded into Aviation and led by a pioneering management team, we have become one of the foremost Aviation Fire Fighting Companies in the world. We operate in the USA and Australia, and we expect to expand to other countries around the world.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We are seeking both a CAPTAIN and a FIRST OFFICER for our CL600 Challenger aircraft. The successful candidates will report and receive all tasking from the Lead Captain of Coulson Aviation, while all scheduled and non-scheduled aircraft maintenance issues are coordinated with the Director of Maintenance, or the company General Manager. This aircraft is US registered, and it operates under Part 91 of the FARs. Operating primarily in Western USA and Canada.

JOB DUTIES:

  • Responsible for the safe and efficient operation of the aircraft and the safety of all passengers on board from take-off to landing.
  • Ensure the aircraft is manned and operated in accordance with all relevant FAA regulations.
  • Complete all flight planning, cross border APIS documentation, coordinate with all relevant FBOs to support the flight, coordinate all passenger transportation at destination, and all other tasks appropriate to ensure the successful completion of the trip(s).
  • Ensure aircraft galley is stocked and cleaned and detailed prior to all flights.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Valid FAA License
  • If not currently FAA Licensed, must hold the Canadian equivalent and be willing to complete the FAA conversion exams
  • Hold a valid passport (Canadian or US) for country of residence
  • Customer service orientation
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Level 5 English proficiency

Captain Hours:

  • 4000+ hours total time
  • 2000 multi-engine
  • 2000 PIC
  • 1000+ turbo jet

First Officer Hours:

  • 1500+ total hours
  • 500+ hour turbine time

Preferably seeking candidates willing to locate to the Lower Mainland BC or mid-Vancouver Island.

A CL600 Type rating an asset.

title: First Officers - (Calgary/Vancouver)
description:
Pacific Coastal Airlines is quickly becoming one of the leading regional airlines in Canada, with some of the most beautiful, remote and sought after coastal destinations in the world. We are currently seeking First Officers to join our growing operations team inCalgary and Vancouver. We are excited to welcome some of the most safety and customer service oriented air crew to join our already amazing team.

Ground School Commences June 13th, 2022

A little bit about us

Pacific Coastal Airlines is headquartered in the South Terminal at the Vancouver International Airport. Under the Pacific Coastal banner, we fly scheduled and charter services between busy international airports, remote destinations, and beautiful communities such as Anahim Lake, Bella Bella, Bella Coola and Kamloops just to name a few. All in the province of beautiful British Columbia. Our recent CAPACITY PUCHASE AGREEMENT with WestJet, formally known as WestJet Link, allows us to open up even more operational opportunity in Southern Alberta, and creates an exciting opportunity for candidates desiring to be based in the region as part of the Pacific Coastal team.

We also take great pride in supporting our local communities, and our commitments include support for various charities and organizations such as Special Olympics and Native Education College just to name a few.

To learn more about us you can check us out here;

https://www.pacificcoastal.com/

Here's what you will bring;

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 750 hours' + total time
  • CPL with IATRA or ATPL (IATRA must be completed within last 18 months)
  • Current Multi Engine IFR
  • Valid Category 1 Medical Certificate
  • Ability to travel away from home, including overnights
  • Flexibility to work varying shifts
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Restricted Area Identity Card
  • Must be Canadian citizen or Canadian permanent resident
  • Ability to travel to/from the United States without restrictions
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds unassisted

Please note: As pilot applications far exceed job vacancies, preference will be given to candidates with qualifications beyond the minimum requirements, including but not limited to:

  • Graduate of a recognized degree program
  • Aviation College degree or diploma
  • Flight experience in addition to the minimum
  • Commercial or military flight experience
  • Jet and/or turbo-prop multi-crew experience

Our Offerings

Company Culture:We honour our company motto of People Friendly, People First for both our employees and our passengers. We encourage a positive, caring workplace and put a high value on collaboration, accountability, and loyalty. We are inclusive, respectful, and have a friendly corporate culture.

Compensation: We recognize and value industry experience by offering competitive compensation commensurate with prior experience. We offer long term pay progression to recognize years of service as well as a company match Group RRSP for retirement planning.

Health Benefits: We offer a standard benefits package for permanent employees consisting of extended health, dental, vision, travel medical, life insurance, AD&D, short-term disability, long-term disability, an employee and family assistance program, paid sick days, and paid personal emergency days.

Travel Benefits: We offer excellent travel perks within the Pacific Coastal network for employees, their eligible family members, and their buddies. Also available to employees and their eligible family members is standby travel on other airlines across the world and reciprocal jumpseat agreements for pilots with major Canadian airlines including Air Canada, WestJet, Air Transat, Sunwing, Jazz, and more. Additionally, employees are eligible for discounts with various hotels and restaurants within the communities we serve as well as steeply discounted cargo shipping within the Pacific Coastal network.

Employee Programs: We have employee recognition and reward programs, a milestone service recognition program and employee appreciation events throughout the year.

Interested applicants please complete your job application by clicking on https://pacificcoastal.prevueaps.com/jobs/

While we thank all pilots interested in joining the Pacific Coastal Airlines team, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Pacific Coastal Airlines is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to a policy of non-discrimination in all of our employment practices. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, age, disability or any other identifying characteristic.

title: Assistant Chief Pilot
description:
SKYSERVICE BUSINESS AVIATION 

Skyservice is a North American leader in business aviation. Built on the key principles of safety and service excellence, we provide a full service experience from Aircraft Management, Aircraft Charter, Maintenance and Aircraft sales from our Fixed Base Operations that span Canada and the western United States. People and values are the inseparable assets that drive our dedication to Quality, Safety, Respect, Commitment and Efficiency. These are the core values that guide us every day and help build our reputation as leaders in aviation services. Skyservice is a team dedicated to supporting and developing our employees. If you want to grow your career and broaden your experience, then Skyservice is the right team for you.

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Support the National Chief Pilot (NCP) to ensure the delivery of ‘best in class’ pilot/crew services to Skyservice Managed Clients, and foster a culture that attracts, retains, engages and drives exceptional performance and service; 
  • Ensure safe and efficient pilot/crew operations that comply with all federal and local regulations;
  • Assess the ability of crew members to meet regulatory requirements with regards to their designated duties including conducting checkrides;
  • Oversee or support personnel related issues for all crew members and direct reports, working in collaboration with HR as required;
  • Effectively manage direct reports by providing support and coaching;
  • Build relationships with Managed Clients and assigned pilots, monitors service levels and client satisfaction, resolving issues quickly as they arise;
  • Gather information for all mission, accident, incident and occurrence report investigations and closings;
  • Ensure the prevention and investigation of all pilot/crew related occurrence reports including actioning and follow-up;
  • Work closely with the Director, Flight Operations, Director, Pilot Training and other leaders to develop short and long term plans to support the growth of the business;
  • Ensure effective two-way communication with Managed Aircraft Lead Captains and crew members in order to gather feedback and proactively address concerns;
  • Prepare technical data on new routes and aerodromes, assessing their operational suitability and the training required prior to introduction;
  • When required act as the National Chief Pilot when the NCP is unavailable.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS REQUIRED:
  • Airline Transport Pilot Licence (ATPL) with a valid Instrument Rating for an aircraft subject to CAR, Part VII, Subpart 4;
  • Approved Check Pilot (ACP) qualified is an asset (ability to conduct check rides);
  • Type rating for at least one type of aircraft operated and qualified to act as a PIC on one of the types to be operated;
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a PIC;
  • Experience in corporate aviation is preferred;
  • In-depth knowledge of all relevant aviation regulations;
  • Significant track record in building a team of high performing and engaged pilots;
  • Strong leadership skills;
  • Superior customer service, relationship building and influencing skills;
  • Collaborative and oriented towards continuous improvement;
  • Ability to work in fast-paced, high-pressure environment;
  • Flexible to work additional hours and be on-call as required;
  • High safety orientation as well as experience with SMS / safety management processes.

Skyservice is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. If for any reason you cannot apply through our job board, please contact a member of our Human Resources team for special accommodation.

title: Agents de Bord
description:
Description

Avez-vous déjà rêvé de parcourir le monde? De faire partie d’une équipe qui se démarque dans l’industrie et qui s’efforce d’atteindre de nouveaux sommets? D’accueillir chaleureusement et de servir chaque année plus de 40 millions de clients qui font des voyages inoubliables qui changent leur vie? De représenter fièrement le Canada sur la scène mondiale?

Nous acceptons les candidatures de personnes qui nous aideront à passer du statut de l’une des meilleures sociétés aériennes en Amérique du Nord à l’une des 10 meilleures sociétés aériennes du monde. Vous serez le visage et la personnalité d’Air Canada en nous aidant à écrire le prochain chapitre de nos 80 ans d’histoire.

Nous sommes à la recherche de personnes qui possèdent les qualités qui font la réputation des Canadiens, à savoir la cordialité et la gentillesse, offertes avec soin et avec classe. Si vous êtes prêt à être un ambassadeur d’Air Canada — et du Canada — chaque fois que vous prenez l’avion, voici peut-être votre occasion de briller.

Nous offrons des postes temporaires à notre base de Toronto et Calgary.

Important à savoir:

  • Chaque voyage est important. Les agents de bord d’Air Canada se comportent toujours avec les égards et la classe qui font la réputation des hôtes canadiens.
  • Les voyages en avion peuvent être stressants pour les clients, mais nous pouvons y remédier. Les agents de bord d’Air Canada se mettent à la place de nos clients et ils les traitent avec cordialité, élégance et dignité, en leur offrant l’expérience à bord la plus raffinée et agréable qui soit.
  • Les agents de bord d’Air Canada sont des ambassadeurs du Canada. En tant que transporteur national du Canada, nous sommes fiers de montrer notre image canadienne unique au reste du monde et d’offrir une expérience aussi remarquable que notre vaste pays.

Qualifications

Plus précisément, voici les qualités que le candidat doit posséder : 
  • Il est axé sur la sécurité avant tout, car il s’agit d’une partie essentielle de l’excellence du service clientèle.
  • Il fait naturellement preuve d’empathie et de courtoisie en toutes circonstances.
  • Il traite toujours les autres avec respect et manifeste naturellement une attitude chaleureuse et attentionnée.
  • Il se passionne pour l’excellence du service.
  • Il représente fièrement le Canada au pays et à l’étranger.
  • Il a une bonne écoute et il se concentre sur la recherche de solutions.
  • Il est à l’aise de parler publiquement.
  • Il respecte l’importance des règles et des règlements de l’industrie et d’Air Canada.
  • Il est prêt à porter notre uniforme parfaitement, avec fierté, en respectant nos normes détaillées relatives à l’apparence.
  • Il est âgé d’au moins 18 ans.
  • Il détient un passeport canadien en cours de validité qui lui permet de se rendre dans tous les pays desservis par Air Canada.
  • Il est disposé à travailler à des heures irrégulières (matins, soirées, fins de semaine et jours fériés chômés) étant donné qu’un horaire de travail très flexible est nécessaire pour occuper ce poste.
Conditions d’emploi et considérations importantes:  
  • Nous sommes déterminés à faire en sorte que nos agents de bord reçoivent la meilleure formation possible. Vous suivrez notre programme de formation pour agents de bord d’Air Canada, d’une durée de sept semaines.
  • Vous êtes prêt à déménager à notre base canadiennes à Toronto ou Calgary.
  • En tant qu’agent de bord certifié, le salaire horaire est de 28,28$. Veuillez noter que la formation sera rémunérée à un tarif inférieur.
  • Afin que vous puissiez obtenir l’autorisation de sécurité de Transports Canada, nous vérifierons le casier judiciaire de tous les candidats.
  • Les agents de bord effectuent des tâches essentielles à la sécurité et doivent, à ce titre, satisfaire aux exigences médicales d’Air Canada afin d’être admissibles à ce poste. Les candidats seront assujettis à une évaluation médicale, y compris à un test de dépistage de drogues et d’alcool, et ne doivent pas être sous l’effet de substances intoxicantes.
  • Vaccination contre la COVID-19 requise
  • Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisations requises pour le poste.
Compétences linguistiques 
 
En tant que transporteur national du Canada et transporteur canadien le plus international, nous sommes fiers d’offrir des services bilingues. À ce titre, les candidats doivent parler français et anglais ou parler une ou plusieurs des langues suivantes en plus de l’anglais : français, japonais, italien, allemand, hébreu, grec, hindi, pendjabi.
 
Diversité et inclusion
 
Air Canada est résolument engagée en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et gratifiant qui met en valeur la contribution unique de nos employés au succès de notre entreprise.
 
En tant qu’employeur qui garantit l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi, nous encourageons les candidatures les plus diverses afin de pouvoir nous doter d’un effectif varié et représentatif de nos clients et des communautés où nous vivons et offrons nos services.

On Call (Fixed Term)

CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.

title: Pilot (for non AC-Express Pilots only)
description:
Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.
Whether a Captain, a First Officer or Relief Pilot, an Air Canada pilot's number one priority is to conduct each flight safely with due consideration to passenger comfort and on-time performance.
While the typical work month consists of approximately 80 hours of flying, pilots spend many additional hours on such ground duties as preparing flight plans, readying the aircraft for departure, and completing post-flight reports. A day's work may vary from a long-range international flight to a sequence of shorter domestic flights. Reserve duty, in which the pilot is "on call", may also be assigned.
Air Canada pilots operate out of one of the four crew bases: Montreal, Toronto, Winnipeg or Vancouver. Base preferences are awarded in seniority so pilots must be willing to relocate as assigned. Pilots typically begin their career as a First Officer on domestic aircraft or as a Relief Pilot on long-range, international flights.

To fly for Air Canada, pilots must meet certain basic requirements:
  • 2000 hours of fixed wing flying time
  • Ability to pass the Air Canada and Transport Canada medical and visual acuity requirements for a Category 1 medical certificate
  • Canadian Airline Transport Pilot Licence (ATPL), current Group 1 (Multi-engine) Instrument Rating
  • Canadian citizenship or landed immigrant status
  • The ability to hold a Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC)
Pilot applications far exceed job vacancies, so preference is given to candidates with qualifications beyond the basic requirements. Examples of desirable additional qualifications include, but are not limited to:
  • Graduates of a three or four year diploma/degree program from a college or university
  • Aviation College degree or diploma
  • Commercial or military flight experience
  • Jet and/or turbo-prop multi-crew experience
Conditions of Employment:
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.
  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required
Diversity and Inclusion:
Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.
As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.
Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.
We are aware that coaching programs are being offered by third party companies on Air Canada's pilot interview questions. Please be advised that Air Canada does not endorse any agencies that prepare candidates for our interviews. Candidates who arrive for an interview with prepared answers provided by such agencies are easily recognized and will be assessed accordingly. Interview questions are changed at regular intervals. Providing 'canned' answers will likely result in a poor assessment of your suitability as an Air Canada pilot.

title: First Officers - (Calgary/Vancouver/other)
description:
Pacific Coastal Airlines is quickly becoming one of the leading regional airlines in Canada, with some of the most beautiful, remote and sought after coastal destinations in the world. We are currently seeking B1900 First Officers to join our growing operations team inVANCOUVER. We are excited to welcome some of the most safety and customer service oriented air crew to join our already amazing team.

Ground School Commences June 13th, 2022

A little bit about us

Pacific Coastal Airlines is headquartered in the South Terminal at the Vancouver International Airport. Under the Pacific Coastal banner, we fly scheduled and charter services between busy international airports, remote destinations, and beautiful communities such as Tofino, Bella Bella and Bella Coola just to name a few. All in the province of beautiful British Columbia. This creates an exciting opportunity for candidates desiring to be based in the region as part of the Pacific Coastal team.

We also take great pride in supporting our local communities, and our commitments include support for various charities and organizations such as Special Olympics and Native Education College just to name a few.

To learn more about us you can check us out here;

https://www.pacificcoastal.com/

Here's what you will bring;

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 750 hours' + total time
  • CPL with IATRA or ATPL (IATRA must be completed within last 18 months)
  • Current Multi Engine IFR
  • Valid Category 1 Medical Certificate
  • Ability to travel away from home, including overnights
  • Flexibility to work varying shifts
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Restricted Area Identity Card
  • Must be Canadian citizen or Canadian permanent resident
  • Ability to travel to/from the United States without restrictions
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds unassisted

Please note: As pilot applications far exceed job vacancies, preference will be given to candidates with qualifications beyond the minimum requirements, including but not limited to:

  • Graduate of a recognized degree program
  • Aviation College degree or diploma
  • Flight experience in addition to the minimum
  • Commercial or military flight experience
  • Jet and/or turbo-prop multi-crew experience

Our Offerings

Company Culture:We honour our company motto of People Friendly, People First for both our employees and our passengers. We encourage a positive, caring workplace and put a high value on collaboration, accountability, and loyalty. We are inclusive, respectful, and have a friendly corporate culture.

Compensation: We recognize and value industry experience by offering competitive compensation commensurate with prior experience. We offer long term pay progression to recognize years of service as well as a company match Group RRSP for retirement planning.

Health Benefits: We offer a standard benefits package for permanent employees consisting of extended health, dental, vision, travel medical, life insurance, AD&D, short-term disability, long-term disability, an employee and family assistance program, paid sick days, and paid personal emergency days.

Travel Benefits: We offer excellent travel perks within the Pacific Coastal network for employees, their eligible family members, and their buddies. Also available to employees and their eligible family members is standby travel on other airlines across the world and reciprocal jumpseat agreements for pilots with major Canadian airlines including Air Canada, WestJet, Air Transat, Sunwing, Jazz, and more. Additionally, employees are eligible for discounts with various hotels and restaurants within the communities we serve as well as steeply discounted cargo shipping within the Pacific Coastal network.

Employee Programs: We have employee recognition and reward programs, a milestone service recognition program and employee appreciation events throughout the year.

Interested applicants please complete your job application by clicking on https://pacificcoastal.prevueaps.com/jobs/

While we thank all pilots interested in joining the Pacific Coastal Airlines team, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Pacific Coastal Airlines is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to a policy of non-discrimination in all of our employment practices. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, age, disability or any other identifying characteristic.

We are welcoming new Flight Attendants who will help elevate us from the #1 airline in North-America to a top-10 Global Airline in all that we do. You will be the face and personality of Air Canada, helping us shape the next chapter of our 80-year story.

We’re proud to share the qualities that make Canada great with our customers: empathy and warmth delivered with care and class. We are seeking talented, caring individuals ready to be ambassadors for Canada and Air Canada every time we fly.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

title: Pilote (pour les candidats qui ne sont pas des pilotes d'Air Canada Express)
description:
Description

Se joindre à Air Canada, c’est faire partie d’un symbole emblématique canadien récemment classé meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Lancez votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe diverse et dynamique, à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers.     
 
La priorité absolue d’un pilote d’Air Canada, qu’il soit commandant de bord, premier officier ou pilote de relève, est d’assurer chaque vol en toute sécurité, tout en veillant au confort des passagers et à la ponctualité.  
               
Le mois type de travail d’un pilote comporte environ 80 heures de vol, mais aussi d’autres heures consacrées à des tâches au sol comme la préparation des plans de vol, la préparation de l’avion pour le départ et les rapports à remplir après le vol. Une journée de travail peut varier d’un long vol international à une série de courts vols intérieurs. On pourra aussi attribuer au pilote une période de réserve pendant laquelle il est « sur appel ».          
 
Les pilotes d’Air Canada sont rattachés à l’une de nos quatre bases : Montréal, Toronto, Winnipeg et Vancouver. On donne la priorité du choix de la base d’affectation aux pilotes qui comptent le plus d’ancienneté; il faut donc être prêt à déménager, au besoin. Habituellement, les pilotes commencent leur carrière comme premier officier sur des liaisons intérieures ou comme pilote de relève sur des liaisons internationales long-courriers.

Qualifications

Pour devenir pilote d’Air Canada, il faut répondre à certaines exigences de base :   
  • 2 000 heures de vol sur appareils à voilure fixe.        
  • Réussite des examens médicaux et d’acuité visuelle d’Air Canada et de Transports Canada menant à l’obtention d’un certificat médical de catégorie 1.         
  • Licence canadienne de pilote de ligne; qualification valide de vol aux instruments pour avions multimoteurs (groupe 1).         
  • Citoyenneté canadienne ou statut de résident permanent.         
  • Admissible à l’obtention d’une carte d’identité de zone réglementée (CIZR).   
Le nombre de pilotes qui postulent est largement supérieur au nombre de postes disponibles; nous accordons donc une préférence aux candidats dont les qualifications dépassent les exigences de base. Les qualifications supplémentaires souhaitables comprennent entre autres ce qui suit :       
  • Diplôme d’un établissement collégial ou universitaire obtenu à la suite d’un programme d’études de trois ou quatre ans.       
  • Diplôme d’études collégiales en aviation.       
  • Expérience de vol commercial ou militaire.       
  • Expérience de vol dans un avion à réaction ou à hélice avec plusieurs équipages.     
 
Conditions d’emploi
  • Les candidats doivent être admissibles à travailler dans le pays concerné, au moment où toute offre d’emploi leur est présentée. L’obtention de permis, visas ou autres autorisations susceptibles d’être exigés relève de l’entière responsabilité des candidats qui postulent cet emploi.
  • Vaccination obligatoire contre la COVID-19.
Diversité et inclusion
 
Air Canada est résolument engagée en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion, et elle vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et gratifiant, qui met en valeur la contribution unique de nos employés à la réussite de notre Société.
 
En tant qu’employeur qui garantit l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi, nous acceptons les candidatures de toutes les personnes afin de nous doter d’un effectif varié et représentatif de la diversité de nos clients et des collectivités où nous vivons et offrons nos services.
 
Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt. Toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les candidats retenus pour la suite du processus.
 
Nous sommes conscients que des entreprises tierces proposent des programmes d’encadrement visant les questions posées aux pilotes en entrevue à Air Canada. Sachez qu’Air Canada ne cautionne aucune des agences qui préparent les candidats à nos entrevues. Nous distinguons aisément les candidats qui se présentent en entrevue avec des réponses préparées par de telles agences et nous évaluons leur candidature en conséquence. Nous modifions régulièrement les questions d’entrevue. Des réponses toutes faites vous vaudront probablement une piètre évaluation de vos aptitudes à occuper un poste de pilote à Air Canada.
